Pre-Game Insights: Apostolos Stamatelopoulos is back in the Subway Socceroos squad and is determined to make an impact in our upcoming FIFA World Cup 2026â„¢ Round Three qualifiers against China PR and Japan.

Stamatelopoulos scored his first goal for new club Motherwell after returning from a hamstring injury and is looking forward to continuing his goal-scoring form in front of a home crowd at Adelaide Oval this Thursday.
Stamatelopoulos feels confident in front of goal, stating that whenever he goes into a game, he feels like he will score regardless of the location.
The team is focused on getting three points from the game against China PR and believes they can bounce back after the disappointing results against Bahrain and Indonesia.
Stamatelopoulos expects China PR to play defensively, so the focus will be on breaking them down and scoring the first goal to open up the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Stamatelopoulos' wife had their son while he was away, and they are now together again.
The match against China PR will be held at Adelaide Oval on Thursday, 10 October 2024, with a kick-off time of 7:30 pm ACDT (8:00 pm AEDT).
